title: Pipelining Basics
subject: Computer Organization
theory:
Overlap execution of instructions. 
Like Assembly Line. 
While Inst 1 is Executing, Inst 2 is Decoding, Inst 3 is Fetching. 
Increases **Throughput** (Inst per second) but not Latency (Time per inst).

examples.code:
Non-Pipeline: 3 inst * 5 cycles = 15 cycles.
Pipeline: 1 inst per cycle (ideal) -> 5 + 1 + 1 = 7 cycles.

common_mistakes.mistake: Thinking pipeline reduces single instruction time
common_mistakes.correction: It often increases individual latency (overhead) but massively boosts total completion rate.
